task.title: Tutorials: Developing an information set with maps
task.shortdesc: These tutorials introduce you to DITA maps, and show you how to apply them in developing a task-oriented, scenario-based, information-typed Web and users guide.

taskbody.prereq:
Before you start, you should be familiar with the following tasks in your editor:
Opening and saving new documents
Adding elements to documents
Adding attributes to elements
Creating output using IDWB

context.p: Each of the tutorials has a matching sample. You will be copying topic files from the sample so that you can see how the maps control the output for topics. In addition, you can choose to skip portions of the tutorials by copying the map content. See for a listing of the map portions of the samples.

The purpose of these tutorials is not only to show how to use maps to build hierarchies and other kinds of relationships, but to show how these relationships can be derived from an understanding of user tasks, which in turn can be derived from an understanding of usage scenarios through task analysis. This same understanding should inform your entire information architecture, not just the information-type views of your content but also print-oriented organizations optimized for sequential reading.
The tutorials should be performed in sequence. Each tutorial builds on the previous one.
